description:
**Fix Overview**:

To resolve the Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Chromium that affects Microsoft Edge:

1. Update your Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) browser to the latest version, which is 131.0.2903.48 released on November 14, 2024.
2. Verify that the update has been applied by going to the browser settings:
   - Click on the 3 dots (...) on the upper right-hand side of the window.
   - Navigate to Help and feedback > About Microsoft Edge.

**Details**:
- This update addresses the vulnerability categorized as CWE-79 (Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation).
- Ensuring your browser is updated will help protect against potential attacks that exploit this issue.
- For more information about the version, visit the Google Chrome release notes. 

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure you are running a Chromium-based version of Microsoft Edge.
- Backup any important browser data before upgrading, if necessary.
